intro: Oxanthera neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia oxanthera, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive veining pattern. Oxanthera neocaledonica is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in forest understories.
